name: Advanced File Operations & Date Formatting
description: Learn advanced file operations and date formatting commands

flashcards.question: How do you display the current time in 24-hour format?
How do you display the current date in MM/DD/YYYY format?
How do you display the type of the /etc/passwd file?
What command do you use to display the type of the /bin/passwd file?
flashcards.example:
$ file /bin/passwd
/bin/passwd: setuid ELF 64-bit LSB shared object, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV)...

flashcards.question: How do you display the type of the /home directory?
How do you view the contents of multiple files?
flashcards.answer: Use cat followed by the file names.
flashcards.example:
$ cat file1.txt file2.txt
... (contents of file1.txt)
... (contents of file2.txt)

flashcards.question: How do you view the first 3 lines of the /etc/passwd file?
What command displays the last 10 lines of a file by default?
flashcards.answer: tail followed by the file name.

flashcards.question: How do you count lines, words, and characters in the /etc/passwd file?
What command counts the number of lines in /etc/passwd and /etc/group?
flashcards.answer: Use wc -l followed by the file names.
